pedi-ya.order.stocks.description: Please provide some valid stock market symbol like:
pedi-ya.order.stocks.text1: Stock market example shows how to implement
pedi-ya.order.stocks.text4: Updating symbol query with different symbol will emit action which updates state with loading flag (reducer) and triggers effect for retrieving of selected stock.
pedi-ya.order.stocks.text5: Actions are debounced and every subsequent request will cancel previous one using
pedi-ya.order.stocks.text6: Success or error actions are emitted on request completion. Loading spinner is removed and stock info or error message is displayed.

pedi-ya.order.elements.title: Angular Elements (and other web components)
pedi-ya.order.elements.text1: The button on the left side is a web component from the mwc (material web components) library. The web component was lazy loaded from the
pedi-ya.order.elements.text2: url only when it was first time displayed in the template of the parent Angular component.
pedi-ya.order.elements.text3: This seamless lazy-loading and usage was achieved just by using simple
pedi-ya.order.elements.text8: where it can bring the most value to your projects
pedi-ya.order.simple-state-management.te: NgRx is a great state management library but sometimes it can be an overkill to use it in simpler applications with limited routing or state sharing needs.

In these cases we usually reach for solution involving RxJs BehaviorSubject which enables to share our state as an Observable stream while also enabling service to imperatively retrieve and mutate Subjects state imperatively...
This pattern was wrapped and made more convenient by
which is a simple state management with minimalistic API, one way data flow, multiple models support and immutable data exposed as RxJS Observable
You can also add it to your project using
